content: dappled path mitts designed by sophie mckane for unicorn designs sizes yarn one size to fit hand circumference 18-22 dk or light worsted weight yarn 100-120m cm/7-9 designed to fit with 2-6cm/1-2 5 / 110-130 yards negative ease sample shown in zakami superwash actual circumference 16 cm/7 merino dk1 colourway autumn bonfire unstretched actual length 20 5 cm/8 malabrigo rios2 colourway playa and adapt to different sizes by adding or manos del uruguay silk blend colourway removing sts in multiples of 3 and cincuenta3 adjusting length as needed for instance to make smaller mitts cast on 33 or 36 sts notions instead of 39 sts 3 75mm/us 5 double-pointed needles or long circular for magic loop gauge 1 stitch marker 26 sts x 34 rnds = 10cm/4 slipped st rib waste yarn in the round unstretched on larger 3 25mm/us 3 double-pointed needles or needles long circular for magic loop for edging 1 100% superwash merino dk weight 225m per 100g skein 2 100% merino worsted weight 192m per 100g skein 3 70% merino 30% silk dk weight 137m per 50g skein dappled path mitts sophie mckane for unicorn designs copyright 2026 sophie mckane unicornknitdesigns@gmail com mailing list signup http //eepurl com/ccra3p instagram @unicornknitdesigns #unicornknitdesigns ravelry group https //www ravelry com/groups/unicorn-designs 1 notes ● as an alternative to dk or light worsted weight yarn most knitters can achieve the same gauge with two strands of fingering/4ply held together or one strand of fingering/4ply yarn held with one strand of laceweight mohair ● samples pictured used the following quantities ○ zakami superwash merino dk - 47g ○ malabrigo rios - 55g ○ manos del uruguay silk blend - 43g construction these mitts are knit in the round from the bottom up a simple 2-round slipped stitch rib is worked throughout the integrated thumb gusset uses k1yok1 increases at the centre of the gusset stitches are held for the thumb and knitting continues for the top of the hand with the edging worked on a smaller needle to ensure a snug finish stitches are returned to the needle and the thumb is completed in the round instructions make 2 identical mitts slip sts purlwise with yarn held in back of work slipped st rib pattern round 1 p2 k1 to end round 2 p2 sl1 to end these 2 rnds form the pattern cuff note for a slender wrist work this section on smaller needles using larger needles and a long-tailed or other stretchy method c/o 39 sts pm and join to work in the round being careful not to twist work slipped st rib pattern for 24 rnds ending after a round 2 thumb gusset round 1 increase p2 k1yok1 into next st p2 k1 to end 2 sts increase d 41 sts round 2 p2 k3 p2 sl1 to end round 3 increase p2 k1 k1yok1 into next st k1 p2 k1 to end 2 sts increase d 43 sts round 4 p2 sl1 p1 k1 p1 sl1 p2 sl1
